definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: They (China) are mistakenly trying to impose a flawed Monroe Doctrine in their backyard.
sentences.chinese: 中国错误的想在自己的后院实施有缺陷的门罗主义。

sentences.english: " At least, "Monroe Doctrine" is the United States, the important principle of regional hegemony.
sentences.chinese: 至少“门罗主义”是美国的地区霸权主义的重要原则。

sentences.english: This week in our series, Kay Gallant and Harry Monroe tell more about that period.
sentences.chinese: 这在我们的系列，凯门罗浩和哈利告诉周的任期。

sentences.english: Call it the Monroe Doctrine, Chinese style.
sentences.chinese: 有人称之为“中国式的门罗主义“。

sentences.english: Early in his administration, Monroe undertook a goodwill tour.
sentences.chinese: 在执政早期，门罗展开了一趟慈善之旅。

sentences.english: He next sent Monroe to Paris in 1803.
sentences.chinese: 接着，杰弗逊在1803年再次派遣门罗去巴黎。

sentences.english: "Monroe Doctrine"has become the cornerstone of U.
sentences.chinese: “门罗主义”成为美国外交政策的基石。
门罗接替麦迪逊当上总统。

sentences.english: People came to Menlo Park from far and near.
sentences.chinese: 人们从四面八方前来门罗园拜访。

sentences.english: Events recently reveal a surprising extension of his Monroe Doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 最近的事态表明，他的门罗主义又有一个惊人的发展。

definition: Hill (name)/Christopher Hill, US undersecretary of state of East Asian affairs
